bill.title: Voting; Late Registration; Absentee Polling Places ($)
bill.description: Allows voter registration at absentee polling places beginning in 2016 and late voter registration, including on election day, beginning in 2018. Appropriates funds. (HB2590 CD1)

history.action: Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 7
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-11-14 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-13-14 at 2:00pm.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Thursday, 02-13-14 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Har, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Kawakami, C. Lee, Nakashima, Tsuji, Wooley, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Ito, Thielen.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 537-14) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Johanson voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cachola, Carroll, Creagan, Nakashima, Takumi excused (5).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Wednesday, 02-19-14 3:00PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 16 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Nishimoto, Johanson, Cullen, Hashem, Ing, Kobayashi, Lowen, Onishi, Takayama, Woodson, Yamashita, Fukumoto, Ward; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Jordan, Morikawa; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Tokioka.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 586-14), recommending passage on Third Reading.

Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Awana, Fale, Hanohano, Jordan, Kawakami, Morikawa, Onishi, Oshiro, Tokioka, Ward voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Say excused (2). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 109).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to JDL, WAM.
The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 03-14-14 10:00AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Galuteria, Ihara; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Slom ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard, Solomon.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2986) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 03-28-14 9:25AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 13 Aye(s): Senator(s) Ige, Kidani, Chun Oakland, Dela Cruz, English, Espero, Kahele, Keith-Agaran, Kouchi, Ruderman, L. Thielen, Tokuda; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Slom ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3360) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-08-14.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 1 (Senator(s) Slom). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 660) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 676).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Hee Chair; Ige Co-Chair; Shimabukuro Member.
House Conferees Appointed: Rhoads, Ing Co-Chairs; Creagan, Thielen Members.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 684).
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 673).
Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Thursday, 04-17-14 1:30PM in conference room 325.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Wednesday 04-23-14 1:30PM in conference room 325.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 04-25-14 1:30PM in conference room 325.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 04-25-14 at 3:30PM in Conference Room 325.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 3 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Ing, Creagan; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Thielen.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Ige, Shimabukuro; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 140-14) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday 04-29-14.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 140-14).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 04-29-14.

Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). 24 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Baker, Dela Cruz, English, Kahele, Keith-Agaran, Kidani, Kim, Kouchi, Nishihara, Solomon . 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom. 0 Excused: none.

Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with Representative(s) Aquino, Brower, Carroll, Cullen, Hashem, Ichiyama, Johanson, Matsumoto, McKelvey, Say, Thielen, Tsuji, Ward, Yamashita, Yamane voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Awana, Fale, Fukumoto, Hanohano, Har, Jordan, Kawakami, McDermott, Oshiro, Tokioka voting no (10) and Representative(s) Ito excused (1).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 720).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 751).
Transmitted to Governor.
